episodes.title: EX-CULT MEMBER SPEAKS OUT: Diane Benscoter on "The Moonies" | The Kotodama Podcast Ep. 18
episodes.description:
What really happens inside a cult, and how do intelligent, compassionate people get pulled in?

In this episode of The Kotodama Podcast, I sat down with Diane Benscoter, a former member of the Unification Church (often referred to as “The Moonies”), who joined at just 17 years old. Diane speaks candidly about the psychological manipulation, identity loss, and emotional hooks that kept her inside, and the long, difficult journey of reclaiming her voice after leaving.

I intend that this conversation helps all of us to have more compassion and understanding for people who went through something similar like Diane, and learn what we can do to avoid falling victim to the psychological manipulation tactics of cult groups.

Diane and I explored:
- Why anyone can be vulnerable to cult influence
- The subtle psychological tactics cults use (us vs. them, love bombing, charisma)
- How loneliness, purpose, and community are often exploited
- What leaving a cult does to your sense of identity
- Why empathy — not judgment — is essential when talking about cult members
- How modern technology, media, and disinformation use similar manipulation tactics today

Diane offers rare insight into how belief systems take hold, how cognitive dissonance works, and why awareness and self-reflection are more important than ever in our current world.

If you’re interested in psychology, cult dynamics, spirituality, personal growth, autonomy, or critical thinking, this episode is for you!

“One person can make a lot of change.”
